title: Collaborative Reflection and Co-Learning for University Collaboration Network Development (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of higher education policies and collaborative learning theories
context.additional_context: Learners consist of university stakeholders (professors, administrators, researchers) with diverse cultural backgrounds, primarily using smartphones as the medium. Providing continuous feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Can explain at least three strategies for establishing inter-university collaborative networks
Applies collaborative reflection and collaborative learning methodologies to real-world cases to develop implementation plans

Over six months, learners can conduct structured dialogue sessions at least twice a month with various stakeholders within an organization (executives, colleagues, external partners) and host at least three experience-sharing workshops to document and share at least five organizational learning cases.

Learners can participate in asynchronous discussions on an LMS (twice weekly, 300+ characters) and write reflective journals (weekly, 500+ characters). By the end of the course, they must submit 12 discussion records and 6 journal entries, achieving at least 80% on the instructor-provided rubric (participation, depth, consistency).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
